title: CozmicGo
description:
CozmicGo connects celebrities & influencers to eventgoers to bring social media into the real world.

I designed, developed, and deployed over 120 features as the product manager amongst 6 developers, increasing sprint velocity 70%.

Key features I worked on include a transactional database system, encrypted check-ins, and a mutual friends algorithmn. As a PM, I led scrums; defined framework, backend, and app teams; and coordinated dev efforts on larger features.

title: BoxletAdmin
description:
The BoxletAdmin iOS app provides business automation & reporting for Boxlet Storage, an AirBnB for Storage. 

Working with nontechnical members of our team, I define admin processes, then provide an interface for server-side financial and database adjustment.

Both statistical reporting and admin services are provided by the app. Deployed securely via a NodeJS deployment server.

title: Boxlet - React
description:
Boxlet Storage, an AirBnB for Storage, needed a responsive, web counterpart to its mobile apps.

I PM'ed the React Web Client for Boxlet. I ensured that we could ship a booking-only MVP within 2 weeks, and the rest of the product functionality within 2 months.

I also architected the application's infrastructure to protect against DDOS-ing our API, regulate data access control, and data separation across our deployment pipeline.

title: Boxlet - API
description:
The Boxlet RESTful API provides the backend logic that keeps all Boxlet services alive. 

I was the lead developer of the Boxlet API. Notable features include enhanced geohash search, a transactional database system to prevent booking complications, a bin-packing algorithmn to manage storers, and access control security authorization via 256b symmetric keys.

title: Boxlet - iOS
description:
The Boxlet iOS client is the largest revenue source for Boxlet Storage, bringing in over 200 bookings annually with nearly 500 downloads.

I built this app entirely on my own as my co-founder developed the Android mirror.

I built a data model cache, a custom object serialization/networking class, and multiple UI framework components to complete a 4 month app in 4 weeks.

title: ARMDevSuite
description:
The ARMDevSuite is a custom cocoapod composed of 12 libraries. 

7 are UI Framework libraries that conform to protocol-delegate design & rapidly increase the speed of app teams. The remainder are logic libraries that provide easy APIs for data model manipulation. 

WIP - documentation required.

title: HidesNight
description:
HidesNight was my first end-to-end iOS application exploring complicated Swift concepts. HidesNight manages high-tech, large-scale games of hide and seek.

The game was originally conceptualized by my friends and I at UC Berkeley. 90 minute games of of hide and seek, played in the dead of night, with GPS assist for the last 30 minutes.

HidesNight taught me to build applications that use Background Modes for location updates, server-generated push notifications, in-app chat, and more.

title: RecruitMate
description:
RecruitMate was an iOS app to help students manage their recruiting pipelines. I built this app with two other developers from MDB, a student org.

RecruitMate applied SaaS B2B marketing practices towards crafting a powerful CRM tool to push internship applications down the pipeline with multiple contacts/recruiters.

I started developing an intelligent email parser to auto update application statuses based on inbound emails from flagged contacts. I also worked on building the pipeline UI, as well as the task/checklist management features.

title: Boxlet - Web
description:
As an initial market test, I built a web app to support peer-to-peer storage.

Within 48 hours we went from nothing to having a full site supporting both listing & booking creation (including payments).

To build the initial web app, I used native HTML/CSS/JS for the front end, along with ExpressJS, Node.JS, Google APIs, Stripe APIs, and more to power the backend.

title: OpptyCall
description:
Built a descriptive and prescriptive Artificial Intelligence that customizes telemarketer calling schedules. After implementation for 40+ users, doubled the organization's call connect rate.

Protected IP; contact for details.

title: GAIL-Q
description:
G2-Crowd AI Lead Qualifier. This was a natural language processing artificial intelligence that I developed in Python to extract and qualify leads sourced from multiple PPL vendors.

Used viterbi segmentation algorithmn, Salesforce API, and LinkedIn API.

Protected IP; contact for details.

title: Marketo-Kenshoo
description:
Built an integration between the Marketo, a marketing automation platform, and Kenshoo, an artificial intelligence PPC bidding tool. Automating this manual process improved ad effectiveness by 10% and reduced outsourcing costs.

Protected IP; contact for details.

title: Senate Campaign
description:
This was my first responsive web-design project. As a campaign manager for an ASUC election, I created a website.

I also wrote macro scripts that automatically farmed emails from the University database based on our candidate's connections

title: Memory Labs
description:
Created two connected applications using Node.JS and HTML/CSS/JS to build a voice-based healthcare assistant for families with loved ones facing Alzheimer's and Dementia. 

Used speech-to-text libraries to manage user interaction, and daemons to alert the user of system-generated events.

title: Escape!
description: Escape from Math Mountain was my very first coding project. I created an educational game using Java Applets. It was a 2-player, math-based racing game in which players compete to escape Math Mountain first by solving 20 problems first.
